      ---  T    H    E     D    I    S    C    O    G    R    A    P    H    Y  ---

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Brought to you by a good-hearted Swede, here is MUCC&#039;s discography - probably the best damn discography the Internet&#039;s ever seen.

So, here it is - my little project since a year and a half ago. MUCC&#039;s discography. Quality rips of all their albums, EPs, singles and live albums ever released. And to top that, I&#039;ve also included non-official releases like their cover album and the three live albums released in 2006. Furthermore, collaborations with other artists, such as the promotional albums from MUCC&#039;s indie-era and more recently cover and tribute albums, are included in this discography. And last, but certainly not least, are their demo tapes released during 1998 and 1999.

Most of the CDs are ripped in 320 kbit/s and some of the older ones in 192 kbit/s. I have edited all filenames and tags (all files are taged with ID3v2.3) and have used multiple sources to make sure release dates and romanizations are correct. I have also written text notes to all the releases displaying important information, track lists and credits and I have normalized all tracks to a peek value of 96 dB with MP3Gain, using Album Gain. Scans from a majority of the CDs are included and all files are tagged with their respective cover art.

"But hey, what&#039;s the cons of this disco then?" you might ask. I&#039;d love to put the word "complete" in the title, but there is two things missing from it, namely their very first demo tape "NO!?" (released in 1997) and the "light" version of their cover album, titled "COVER PARADE mini".
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
INCLUDED PARTS:

This is what you will find in this discography. Notes: A P infront of the title means that partial scans of the CD packaging are included, a C means that complete scans are included. The text inside the box brackets display any "extras" included, such as bonus tracks, bonus CDs, enhanced videos, hidden tracks and so on (all "extras" are included anyhow, so you&#039;re not missing out on anything).

Of these are "Fu wo tataeru uta (2nd press)", "Tsuuzetsu (3rd press)", "Waga, arubeki basho (B type)", "Monochrome no keshiki", "Kuchiki no tou", "Saishuu ressha", "Fuzz" and "Shion" ripped by me.

Enjoy ; )
